intro: Maytenus buchananii, commonly known as the African mayten, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Celastraceae and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers followed by orange-red berries that are an important food source for various wildlife. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories across its native range.
